H0.text: Pounds is a unit that could be used to record the volume of the liquid that a student measured with a graduated cylinder.

H1.text: Meters could be used to record the volume of the liquid measured by a student with a graduated cylinder.

H2.text: Grams is the unit that could be used to record the volume of the liquid measured by the student with a graduated cylinder.

H3.text: Milliliters is a unit that could be used to record the volume of liquid measured by a student with a graduated cylinder.

A4.text: Typical capacities of graduated cylinders are from 10 mL to 1000 mL.

A5.text: The graduated cylinder was first introduced in 1784 by Louis Bernard Guyton de Morveau, for use in volumetric analysis.
